result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A Schmitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (taverns, bars, pubs, or liquor stores)

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Charles A Schmitz in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 9 months jail concurrent to present sentence STAYED for 1 year Probation concurrent to present sentence
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant Charles A Schmitz in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles A Schmitz
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53187   (Effective: 08-11-2015)
Prior: 1551 White Rock Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186
Preliminary hearing on August 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Charles A Schmitz in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco as friend of the Court.    Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Bricco states she will be appointed as counsel on this matter. Bail remains as set. Defense requests a Preliminary Hearing be set .  Court grants request. Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with any other bail conditions set in 14 CF 1137.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Charles A Schmitz in court, in custody, with attorney Erin Menden for attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
